titles.title: Waiving points of order against the conference report to accompany, and providing for corrections in the enrollment of, the joint resolution (H.J. Res 2) making further continuing appropriations for the fiscal year 2003, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-11, by Mr. Hastings (WA).

Rule waives all points of order against the conference report and against its consideration. The rule provides that the conference report shall be considered as read. Finally, the rule provides that upon adoption of the conference report the House shall be considered to have adopted H. Con. Res. 35.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 6.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 71.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 2/13/2003--Passed House without amendment. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.) Waives points of order to provide for the consideration of the conference report accompanying H.J. Res. 2 (making further continuing appropriations for FY 2003). Provides that upon adopting the conference report, the House shall have adopted H. Con. Res. 35 (making technical corrections in the enrollment of H.J. Res. 2).
